sen.j: 斯波 義寛（しば よしとお/よしひろ、康正3年（1457年） - 永正11年4月17日 (旧暦)（1514年5月21日？）は室町時代後期の守護大名。
sen.e: Yoshihiro SHIBA (or Yoshito SHIBA, 1457 – May 21, 1514) was the shugo daimyo (shugo, which were Japanese provincial military governors, that became daimyo,which were Japanese feudal lords) in the late Muromachi period.

Yoshihiro SHIBA (or Yoshito SHIBA, 1457 – May 21, 1514) was the shugo daimyo (shugo, which were Japanese provincial military governors, that became daimyo, which were Japanese feudal lords) in the late Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: daimyo,の後に半角スペースを入れました。
sen.e: Yoshihiro SHIBA (or Yoshito SHIBA, 1457 – May 21, 1514) was the shugo daimyo (shugo, which were Japanese provincial military governors, that became daimyo, which were Japanese feudal lords) during the late Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: スペースを削除しました。

sen.j: 斯波義敏の嫡男で、母は家女房。
sen.e: He was an eldest legitimate son of Yoshitoshi SHIBA, and his mother was Ie no Nyobo (a lady-in-waiting).
He was an eldest legitimate son of Yoshitoshi SHIBA, and his mother was Ie no Nyobo (a lady-in-waiting).
He was an eldest legitimate son of Yoshitoshi SHIBA, and his mother was Ie no Nyobo (a lady-in-waiting).
sen.cmt: スペースを削除しました。

sen.j: 幼名は松王丸。
sen.e: His childhood name was Matsuomaru.
His childhood name was Matsuomaru.
His childhood name was Matsuomaru.

sen.j: 初名義良（よしすけ/よしなが）。
sen.e: His original name was Yoshisuke (o Yoshinaga).
His original name was Yoshisuke (or Yoshinaga).
His original name was Yoshisuke (or Yoshinaga).
sen.cmt: スペースを削除しました。

sen.j: 名は「よしひろ」とも読む。
sen.e: He was also called ' Yoshihiro'.
He was also called 'Yoshihiro'.
sen.cmt: 記号が全角になっています。訂正済み。
sen.e: His name was also read as 'Yoshihiro.'

sen.j: 弟妹に斯波寛元、斯波義雄、斯波義孝室ら。
sen.e: He had two brothers and a sister; Hiromoto SHIBA, Yoshio SHIBA, and Yoshitaka SHIBA's wife.
He had two brothers and a sister; Hiromoto SHIBA, Yoshio SHIBA, and Yoshitaka SHIBA's wife.
sen.cmt: 「斯波寛元、斯波義雄、斯波義孝」名前の読み方ついては、Webで検索しましたが、ヒット数が少なく正しい読み方は不明です。記号が全角になっています。訂正済み。
sen.e: He had two brothers and a sister; Hiromoto SHIBA, Yoshio SHIBA, and Yoshitaka SHIBA's wife.

sen.j: 正室は一色義直の娘。
sen.e: His lawful wife was Yoshinao ISSHIKI's daughter.
His lawful wife was Yoshinao ISSHIKI's daughter.
sen.cmt: 記号が全角になっています。訂正済み。
sen.e: His lawful wife was Yoshinao ISSHIKI's daughter.

sen.j: 子は斯波義達、足利義澄室、村上顕国室ら。
sen.e: His children were Yoshitatsu SHIBA, Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA's wife, and Akikuni MURAKAMI's wife(村上顕国室).
sen.cmt: 村上顕国：正式な読み方は不明です。
sen.e: His children were Yoshitatsu SHIBA, Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA's wife, and Akikuni MURAKAMI's wife(村上顕国室).
sen.cmt: 村上顕国：Webで検索したところ、正式な読み方は不明ですが、「顕国」という漢字で「あきくに」と読む名前は複数見つかりました。記号が全角になっています。訂正済み。
sen.e: His children were Yoshitatsu SHIBA, Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA's wife, and Akikuni MURAKAMI's wife(村上顕国室).

sen.j: 官途は従四位下、治部大輔、左兵衛佐。
sen.e: His kanto (government service) were Jushinoge (Junior Fouth Lank, Lower Grade), Jibu taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of the Civil Administration), and Sahyoe no suke (Assistant Capta in of the Left Division of Middle Palace Guards).

His kanto (government service) were Jushinoge (Junior Fourth Lank, Lower Grade), Jibu taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of the Civil Administration), and Sahyoe no suke (Assistant Capta in of the Left Division of Middle Palace Guards).

His kanto (government service) were Jushinoge (Junior Fourth Lank, Lower Grade), Jibu taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of the Civil Administration), and Sahyoe no suke (Assistant Capta in of the Left Division of Middle Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: スペースを削除しました。

sen.j: 越前国、尾張国、遠江国守護。
sen.e: Shugo (Japanese provincial military governors) of Echizen Province, Owari Province and Totomi Province.
Shugo (Japanese provincial military governors) of Echizen Province, Owari Province and Totomi Province.
Shugo (Japanese provincial military governors) of Echizen Province, Owari Province and Totomi Province.
sen.cmt: スペースを削除しました。

tit.j: 幼年での家督相続と剥奪
tit.e: Succession to the position of family head and deprivation in the early childhood
Succession to the position of family head and deprivation in the early childhood
Succession to the position of family head and deprivation in the early childhood

sen.j: 長禄3年（1459年）8月、父義敏が将軍足利義政の怒りに触れ、3ヶ国の守護職を奪われ大内氏の許へ隠退すると、越前守護代甲斐氏らにより擁立され、僅か3歳で斯波氏家督と3ヶ国守護職を継ぐ。
sen.e: In August, 1459, his father Yoshitoshi made Shogun Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA angry and was deprived his job as shugoshiki (military governor) of 3 provinces, and secluded to the Ouchi clan, therefore Yoshihiro SHIBA succeeded the reigns of the Shiba family and shugoshiki of 3 provinces for only 3 years old under Echizen shugo the Kai clan's support.

In August, 1459, his father Yoshitoshi made Shogun Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA angry and was deprived of his position as shugoshiki (military governor) of 3 provinces, and secluded to the Ouchi clan, therefore Yoshihiro SHIBA succeeded the reigns of the Shiba family and shugoshiki of 3 provinces at the age of 3 under Echizen shugo the Kai clan's support.
sen.cmt: deprived his job→deprived of his pisiton for only 3 years old→at the age of 3に変更しました。
sen.e: In August, 1459, his father Yoshitoshi made Shogun Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA angry and was deprived of his position as shugoshiki (military governor) of 3 provinces, and secluded to the Ouchi clan, therefore Yoshihiro SHIBA succeeded the reigns of the Shiba family and shugoshiki of 3 provinces at the age of 3 under Echizen shugo the Kai clan's support.
sen.cmt: スペースを削除しました。

sen.j: しかし、寛正2年（1461年）9月、朝倉孝景 (7代当主)らの工作により義政から廃嫡を命ぜられ、相国寺の季瓊真蘂に稚児として預けられる。
sen.e: However, in September 1461, Yoshihiro SHIBA was disinherited and left to Kikeishinzui of Shokoku-ji Temple as chigo (temple acolvtes) by Yoshimasa according to the 7th family head Takakage ASAKURA's scheme.

However, in September 1461, Yoshihiro SHIBA was disinherited and left to Kikeishinzui of Shokoku-ji Temple as chigo (temple acolytes) by Yoshimasa according to the 7th family head Takakage ASAKURA's scheme.
sen.cmt: 記号が全角になっています。訂正済み。 Acolvtes→ acolytesに訂正しました。
sen.e: However, in September 1461, Yoshihiro SHIBA was disinherited and left to Kikeishinzui of Shokoku-ji Temple as chigo (temple acolytes) by Yoshimasa according to the 7th family head Takakage ASAKURA's scheme.
sen.cmt: スペースを削除しました。

sen.j: 文正元年（1466年）7月、父義敏の復権に伴い還俗、応仁の乱では東軍に属し、祖父斯波持種、父義敏とともに越前へ下向、同国の西軍斯波義廉方を攻めている。
sen.e: In July 1466, he returned to secular life due to his father Yoshitoshi's restitution, and in the Onin war, he belonged to Eastern Camp and went down to Echizen Province with his grandfather Mochitane SHIBA and father Yoshitoshi, and attacked Yoshikado SHIBA, who belonged to Western Camp of the same province.

In July 1466, he returned to secular life due to his father Yoshitoshi's restitution, and in the Onin war, he belonged to Eastern Camp and went down to Echizen Province with his grandfather Mochitane SHIBA and father Yoshitoshi, and attacked Yoshikado SHIBA, who belonged to Western Camp of the same province.
sen.cmt: 記号が全角になっています。訂正済み。
sen.e: In July 1466, he returned to secular life due to his father Yoshitoshi's restitution, and in the Onin war, he belonged to Eastern Camp and went down to Echizen Province with his grandfather Mochitane SHIBA and father Yoshitoshi, and attacked Yoshikado SHIBA, who belonged to Western Camp of the same province.

sen.j: 文明 (日本)4年（1472年）12月に元服、義良と名乗る。
sen.e: In December 1472, he celebrated his coming of age, and changed his name to Yoshisuke.
In December 1472, he celebrated his coming of age, and changed his name to Yoshisuke.
In December 1472, he celebrated his coming of age, and changed his name to Yoshisuke.

sen.j: 文明7年（1475年）、新将軍足利義尚に謁見、同年、遠江守護代となった甲斐氏とともに遠江に下向し、同国侵攻を続けていた今川義忠の軍勢と対陣する。
sen.e: In 1475, he met shogun Yoshihisa ASHIKAGA, and in the same year, he went down Totomi Province with the Kai clan, who became the Governor of Totomi Province, and battled against Yoshitada IMAGAWA who invaded this province.

In 1475, he met shogun Yoshihisa ASHIKAGA, and in the same year, he went down Totomi Province with the Kai clan, who became the governor of Totomi Province, and battled against Yoshitada IMAGAWA who invaded this province.

In 1475, he met shogun Yoshihisa ASHIKAGA, and in the same year, he went down Totomi Province with the Kai clan, who became the governor of Totomi Province, and battled against Yoshitada IMAGAWA who invaded this province.

sen.j: 翌年の義忠敗死後は朝倉孝景が平定したばかりの越前に目を向け、文明11年（1479年）閏9月4日、叔父斯波義孝、甲斐氏、二宮氏らを引き連れて京都から越前に向けて進発、文明13年（1481年）まで越前の諸所で合戦を繰り広げる。
sen.e: In the next year, after Yoshitada's death in action, he paid more attention to Echizen, that war was just slowed down by Takakage ASAKURA, and left from Kyoto to Echizen together with his uncle Yoshitaka SHIBA, the Kai clan and the Ninomiya clan in September 4, 1479 and batteled there until 1481.

In the next year, after Yoshitada's death in action, he paid more attention to Echizen, that war was just suppressed by Takakage ASAKURA, and left from Kyoto to Echizen together with his uncle Yoshitaka SHIBA, the Kai clan and the Ninomiya clan in September 4, 1479 and battled there until 1481.
sen.cmt: slowed down→suppressedに変更しました。Batteled→battledに訂正しました。記号が全角になっています。訂正済み。
sen.e: In the next year, after Yoshitada's death in action, he paid more attention to Echizen, that war was just suppressed by Takakage ASAKURA, and left from Kyoto to Echizen together with his uncle Yoshitaka SHIBA, the Kai clan and the Ninomiya clan in September 4, 1479 and battled there until 1481.

sen.j: しかし、同年9月15日の合戦で朝倉方に完敗し、加賀国に没落、越前復旧は失敗する。
sen.e: However, in September 15 of the same year, they were totally defeated by Asakura side and ruined to Kaga Province, so they failed to recover Echizen.
However, in September 15 of the same year, they were totally defeated by Asakura side and ruined to Kaga Province, so they failed to recover Echizen.
However, in September 15 of the same year, they were totally defeated by Asakura side and ruined to Kaga Province, so they failed to recover Echizen.

sen.j: 文明15年（1483年）3月、尾張国清洲城に入城、本拠地と定める。
sen.e: In March 1483, he entered Kiyosu of Owari Province and located there as his home ground.
In March 1483, he entered Kiyosu of Owari Province and located there as his home ground.
In March 1483, he entered Kiyosu of Owari Province and located there as his home ground.

sen.j: 文明17年（1485年）、名を義寛と改名、同年出家した父義敏の跡を継いで、尾張・遠江守護となる。
sen.e: In 1485, he changed his name to Yoshihiro, in the same year, his father Yoshitoshi became a priest so he succeeded him and became the shugo (provincial military governor) of Owari Province and Totomi Province.

In 1485, he changed his name to Yoshihiro, in the same year, his father Yoshitoshi became a priest so he succeeded him as the shugo (provincial military governor) of Owari Province and Totomi Province.
sen.cmt: succeed him and became→succeed him as に変更しました。
sen.e: In 1485, he changed his name to Yoshihiro, in the same year, his father Yoshitoshi became a priest so he succeeded him as the shugo (provincial military governor) of Owari Province and Totomi Province.
sen.cmt: スペースを削除しました。

tit.e: Desperate efforts to recover Echizen Province
Desperate efforts to recover Echizen Province
Desperate efforts to recover Echizen Province

sen.j: 長享元年（1487年）の足利義尚による近江国六角高頼攻めに8000の兵を率いて参陣、幕府に忠誠の態度を示して越前回復を訴えるが、要求は退けられる。
sen.e: In 1487, when Yoshihisa ASHIKAGA attacked to Takayori ROKKAKU, Yoshihiro SHIBA joined this war as Yoshihisa side with 8,000 of soldiers on the sake of showing his loyalty for bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by shogun) and appealed them to recover Echizen Province, however they refused his require.

In 1487, when Yoshihisa ASHIKAGA attacked to Takayori ROKKAKU, Yoshihiro SHIBA joined this war as Yoshihisa side with 8,000 of soldiers on the sake of showing his loyalty for bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by shogun) and appealed them to recover Echizen Province, however they refused his require.

In 1487, when Yoshihisa ASHIKAGA attacked to Takayori ROKKAKU, Yoshihiro SHIBA joined this war as Yoshihisa side with 8,000 of soldiers on the sake of showing his loyalty for bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by shogun) and appealed them to recover Echizen Province, however they refused his require.
sen.cmt: スペースを削除しました。

sen.j: 延徳3年（1491年）の足利義稙による六角高頼攻めにも大軍を率いて参陣、重ねて越前回復を訴える。
sen.e: In 1491, Yoshitane ASHIKAGA attacked Takayori ROKKAKU and Yoshihiro joined the war with large force and required bakufu again to take back Echizen Province.
In 1491, Yoshitane ASHIKAGA attacked Takayori ROKKAKU and Yoshihiro joined the war with large force and required bakufu again to take back Echizen Province.
In 1491, Yoshitane ASHIKAGA attacked Takayori ROKKAKU and Yoshihiro joined the war with large force and required bakufu again to take back Echizen Province.

sen.j: この時は義材の越前進発が噂になるなど、義寛に有利に事は進んだが、結局幕府は朝倉氏の軍事力を怖れて、越前回復はならなかった。
sen.e: At that time, it was rumored that Yoshiki departed for Echizen to take back and the things advanced in his favor, however, bakufu did not to get back Echizen in the end because they feared the Asakura clan's military force.

At that time, it was rumored that Yoshiki departed for Echizen to take back and the things advanced in his favor, however, because bakufu feared the Asakura clan's military force, they couldn't get back Echizen after all.
sen.cmt: 記号が全角になっています。訂正済み。文末を中心に文章の流れを若干変更しました。
sen.e: At that time, it was rumored that Yoshiki departed for Echizen to take back and the things advanced in his favor, however, because bakufu feared the Asakura clan's military force, they couldn't get back Echizen after all.

sen.j: 明応2年（1493年）の義材の河内国畠山義豊攻めにも義寛は従軍するが、管領細川政元によるクーデター（明応の政変）に遭い、義材との親密さが災いして幕府内で孤立することとなる。
sen.e: Yoshihiro also served in the Yoshiki's attack against Yoshitoyo HATAKEYAMA in Kawachi Province in 1493, but he was involved in the coups (Coup of Meio) by Masamoto HOSOKAWA, Kanrei (a shogunal deputy)and was insulated from bakufu because he was in close association with Yoshiki.

Yoshihiro also served in the Yoshiki's attack against Yoshitoyo HATAKEYAMA in Kawachi Province in 1493, but he was involved in the coups (Coup of Meio) by Masamoto HOSOKAWA, Kanrei (a shogunal deputy)and was insulated from bakufu because he was in close association with Yoshiki.
sen.cmt: 記号が全角になっています。訂正済み。
sen.e: Yoshihiro also served in the Yoshiki's attack against Yoshitoyo HATAKEYAMA in Kawachi Province in 1493, but he was involved in the coups (Coup of Meio) by Masamoto HOSOKAWA, Kanrei (a shogunal deputy)and was insulated from bakufu because he was in close association with Yoshiki.
sen.cmt: スペースを削除しました。

sen.j: 翌年からは細川政元と提携している今川氏親が遠江に侵攻を開始、義寛はこれに対処しようとするが、明応4年（1494年）に隣国美濃国で舟田合戦が勃発、尾張国内がこれに巻き込まれ、遠江出陣は不可能な状態となる。
sen.e: From the next year, Ujichika IMAGAWA, who associated with Masamoto HOSOKAWA, started to invade Totomi Province, so Yoshihiro tried to meet this, but the battle of Funada occurred in the neighboring country, Mino, in 1494 and Owari Province was involved in this battle, therefore it was impossible for him to depart for Totomi Province.

From the next year, Ujichika IMAGAWA, who associated with Masamoto HOSOKAWA, started to invade Totomi Province, so Yoshihiro tried to meet this, but the battle of Funada occurred in the neighboring country, Mino, in 1494 and Owari Province was involved in this battle, therefore it was impossible for him to depart for Totomi Province.

From the next year, Ujichika IMAGAWA, who associated with Masamoto HOSOKAWA, started to invade Totomi Province, so Yoshihiro tried to meet this, but the battle of Funada occurred in the neighboring country, Mino, in 1494 and Owari Province was involved in this battle, therefore it was impossible for him to depart for Totomi Province.

sen.j: 尾張国内の政情が安定化した明応9年（1500年）頃から義寛は戦略を変更、義材派から新将軍足利義澄派に切り替え、細川政元の支持を得、信濃国小笠原氏、関東管領上杉顕定にも協力を呼びかけ、今川氏を東西から挟撃しようと目論む。
sen.e: From about 1500 when the political situation of Owari Province was stable, he changed a strategy; changed in New Shogun Yoshizumi AHIKAGA group from Yoshiki group, got Masamoto HOSOKAWA's support, appealed to Akisada UESUGI, Kanto Kanrei (a shogunal deputy for the Kanto region) for cooperation, and planed to attack the Imagawa clan from the east and west.

From about 1500 when the political situation of Owari Province was stable, he changed a strategy; changed in New Shogun Yoshizumi AHIKAGA group from Yoshiki group, got Masamoto HOSOKAWA's support, appealed to Akisada UESUGI, Kanto Kanrei (a shogunal deputy for the Kanto region) for cooperation, and planed to attack the Imagawa clan from the east and west.
sen.cmt: 記号が全角になっています。訂正済み。
sen.e: From about 1500 when the political situation of Owari Province was stable, he changed a strategy; changed in New Shogun Yoshizumi AHIKAGA group from Yoshiki group, got Masamoto HOSOKAWA's support, appealed to Akisada UESUGI, Kanto Kanrei (a shogunal deputy for the Kanto region) for cooperation, and planed to attack the Imagawa clan from the east and west.

sen.j: 文亀元年（1501年）、義寛は弟寛元、義雄を遠江に派遣し攻勢をかける。
sen.e: In 1501, Yoshihiro dispatched his two brothers named Hiromoto and Yoshio to Totomi Province and attacked there.
In 1501, Yoshihiro dispatched his two brothers named Hiromoto and Yoshio to Totomi Province and attacked there.
In 1501, Yoshihiro dispatched his two brothers named Hiromoto and Yoshio to Totomi Province and attacked there.

sen.j: しかし、まもなく史料上からその名を消し、その後の動向は不明。
sen.e: However, his name disappeared from the historical materials soon and his later movement is unknown.
However, his name disappeared from the historical materials soon and his later movement is unknown.
However, his name disappeared from the historical materials soon and his later movement is unknown.

sen.j: 一説によると永正11年（1514年）に死去したとされる。
sen.e: It is said that he died in 1514.
It is said that he died in 1514.
It is said that he died in 1514.

sen.j: 1459年（長禄3年）8月、斯波氏家督継承及び越前・尾張・遠江守護補任。
sen.e: In August 1459, he inherited the Shiba family and assumed shugo of Echizen, Owari, and Totomi.
In August 1459, he inherited the Shiba family and assumed shugo of Echizen, Owari, and Totomi.
In August 1459, he inherited the Shiba family and assumed shugo of Echizen, Owari, and Totomi.

sen.j: 1461年（寛正2年）9月、家督及び守護職剥奪。
sen.e: In September 1461, he deprived the reigns of the family and shugoshiki (military of governor).
In September 1461, he was deprived of the reigns of the family and shugoshiki (military of governor).

sen.j: 1472年（文明 (日本)4年）12月、元服。
sen.e: In December 1472, he celebrated his coming of age.
In December 1472, he celebrated his coming of age.
In December 1472, he celebrated his coming of age.

In April 1485, Jushiinoge, Sahyoe no suke.

sen.e: The Shiba family inheritance
Succession of the Shiba family

tit.e: He was granted to use a portion of the real name of the following superiors.
Following names were people who were granted to use a portion of the real name of Yoshihiro SHIBA.
tit.cmt: 斯波氏は三管領の筆頭であり、後に織田家の傀儡のような存在になってしまいますが、斯波義寛の時代には織田氏よりも勢力があったことから、下に列挙されている人名は「偏諱を受けた」織田氏の人々だと解釈しました。
tit.e: Following names were people who were granted to use a portion of the real name of Yoshihiro SHIBA.
